RelatedSentence: Ten Network staff are bracing for a new round of sweeping cost - cutting which will make hundreds of news and production employees redundant and mark the end of the largely unwatched breakfast show Wake Up .

Ten Network staff are bracing for a new round of sweeping cost - cutting which will make hundreds of news and production employees redundant and mark the end of the largely unwatched breakfast show Wake Up .

Sources told Guardian Australia on Monday management was poised to announce the cancellation of Wake Up , with Natarsha Belling and James Mathison , and make changes to Ten Eyewitness News bulletins around the country .

It is understood the state - based bulletins will retain their own news readers , but off - camera employees such as technicians , camera people , floor staff and editors who produce local news will be shed .

Some managers have been asked to halve their staff numbers .

RelatedSentence: Wake Up , which never averaged more than 30,000 viewers , or 10 % of the rival breakfast shows , will disappear 18 months after the network axed its first breakfast experiment , Breakfast with Paul Henry .
Breakfast also failed to lure the audience from Nine 's Today and Seven 's Sunrise , but it did manage a higher average than Wake Up .
